column2: I have decided to entrust you with protecting the [From.GetFullName] as part of your march in recognition of your service and your nobility of spirit.
I have decided to entrust you with protecting the lands of [From.GetFullName] as part of your march in recognition of your service and your nobility of spirit.
I have decided to entrust you with protecting the lands of [FromFromFrom.GetFullName] as part of your march in recognition of your service and your nobility of spirit.
We have decided to immediately revoke the [Root.GetHeldMarchTitleFullName] as well as all associated march privileges. Failure to hand it over peacefully will lead to war.
I humbly accept your decision to revoke the [From.GetHeldMarchTitleFullName], though it grieves me deeply.
I will not allow you to steal my titles and privileges without a fight! You are no longer my liege lord.

While we have declared our independence, our old overlord naturally still refuses to see us as anything more than a wayward vassal and is even now scheming to bring us back under their fold. While the size and prestige of our march means that we should be will able to fight off any such attempts, it will be some time before our independence is grudgingly accepted.

Our old overlord and possibly other neighbouring kingdoms will be able to use the §YRestore March§! casus belli to force us to recognize their suzerainty again. If we can resist their attempts for §Y35§! years, other kings will have no choice but to recognize our independence, and will be able to take on the full trappings of an independent kingdom.
